meanings.definition: Wild birds that are hunted for sport or food.
meanings.sent1: The wildfowl flew gracefully over the lake.
meanings.sent2: I saw a group of wildfowl by the pond.
meanings.sent3: The wildfowl decided to have a race to see who could fly the fastest.
meanings.sent4: The sky was filled with a colorful tapestry of wildfowl.
meanings.sent5: The hunter patiently waited for the wildfowl to come into range.

meanings.definition: A group of wildfowl flying together.
meanings.sent1: The wildfowl soared through the sky in perfect formation.
meanings.sent2: The loud honking of the wildfowl could be heard from afar.
meanings.sent3: The wildfowl held a meeting in the sky to discuss migration plans.
meanings.sent4: The wildfowl moved as one, a synchronized dance in the air.
meanings.sent5: The children watched in awe as the wildfowl painted patterns in the sky.

meanings.sent1: The hunter set out early in the morning to wildfowl.
meanings.sent2: People used to wildfowl for food in the olden days.
meanings.sent3: He decided to wildfowl for his dinner that evening.
meanings.sent4: The group planned to wildfowl in the marshlands.
meanings.sent5: She learned how to wildfowl from her grandfather.
